CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 5, 1955, pg. 2 reads: "Community Problems Panel - First step in solving problems facing the Hill district is to acquaint residents with conditions now existing. And this is what panel members of the discussion sponsored Monday by the Hill District Community Club did at the public meeting in the Centre Avenue YMCA.  THe experts who lectured and answered questions are, left to right, Sidney J. Lindenberg, executive director of Irene Kaufmann Settlement; MRs. Myrna P. Sumpter, teacher at the Letsche School; Alexander J. Allen, executive director of the Urban League of Pittsburgh, program moderator; Mrs. Victoria Hargon, program director of the Girl Scouts of Allegheny County, and the Rev. Harold R. Tolliver, pastor of Grace Memorial Presbyterian Church. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Sidney J. Lindenberg, Myrna P. Sumpter, Alexander J. Allen, Victoria Hargon, and Rev. Harold R. Tolliver posed behind table for public meeting in Centre Avenue YMCA
